programme.desc: Documentary following Texas game wardens as they fight crime and protect natural resources. In South Texas, a warden assists in releasing cold-stunned sea turtles back into the sea. A standard patrol at a fishing spot leads to a drugs bust and a manhunt

programme.title: Meet the Penguins
programme.desc: Crabby, the centres grumpiest resident, greets a new arrival that melts his icy heart, and Princess - queen of the resident penguins - faces the biggest loss of her young life

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Documentary following aquarium-makers Wayde King and Brett Raymer. who head to Indiana to deliver their biggest-ever shark tank

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Charles Jantzen seizes some emaciated horses that were forced to eat dirt to survive. Two of the mares have foals and are struggling to produce milk to feed them

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: An emaciated horse gives birth prematurely, and the foal is so weak Dr Thurston takes it home to bottle feed

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins
programme.desc: Its the middle of summer and the reptiles at Australia Zoo are active and hungry, especially the 44 alligators who inhabit an entire lagoon. Robert has the job of feeding them all at once

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: After the great flood of 2016 devastates Louisiana, Tia and the team help the victims. An elderly woman is put in hospital and separated from her dogs

programme.title: Alaska: Homestead Rescue
programme.sub-title: Home Sweet Homestead: Where the Heart is
programme.desc: The Raneys pass on essential skills to the next generation. Later, they check in via video with homesteaders who built a house with 30,000 rubber tyres

programme.title: Alaska: Homestead Rescue
programme.desc: In Alaska, Marty rescues his property from a deluge of snow runoff. Meanwhile in Hawaii, Matt builds a human-sized slingshot to bring down invasive trees

programme.title: Lone Star Law
programme.desc: Summertime in Texas gives the game wardens plenty to do as they handle a speeding jet-ski rider, drunk boaters, angry campers and a rowdy raccoon

programme.title: Dr Jeff: Rocky Mountain Vet
programme.desc: Dr Jeff and the team head to Mexico to offer free veterinary care for poor families. Over one gruelling week they treat hundreds of animals in need

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Two tastemakers hire Pete Nelson to create a cool treetop structure with a wall of windows and a crows nest

programme.title: Alaska: Surviving the Last Frontier
programme.desc: Following four groups of ordinary people as they travel into the wilderness of Alaska, where they must find a new home in the inhospitable environment and deal with the threat posed by bears, glaciers and their own fears

programme.title: Alaska: The Last Frontier
programme.desc: Changing weather forces the Kilchers to venture miles from home in search of food for winter, with Eivin and Eve stalking big game

programme.title: Alaskan Bush People
programme.desc: The wolfpack prepares for their first ever wedding in the bush, but emotions run high and the Browns struggle to keep their most ambitious project on track

programme.title: Pit Bulls and Parolees
programme.desc: After the great flood of 2016 devastates Louisiana, Tia and the team help the victims. An elderly woman is put in hospital and separated from her dogs

programme.title: Crikey! Its the Irwins

programme.title: Dog Detectives
programme.desc: In Yorkshire, PC Fletchers dog Patto gets injured chasing a burglar. In Merseyside, PC Harris and his dog Kane try to track down the driver of a stolen car

programme.title: Treehouse Masters
programme.desc: Two tastemakers hire Pete Nelson to create a cool treetop structure with a wall of windows and a crows nest

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Charles Jantzen seizes some emaciated horses that were forced to eat dirt to survive. Two of the mares have foals and are struggling to produce milk to feed them

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: An emaciated horse gives birth prematurely, and the foal is so weak Dr Thurston takes it home to bottle feed

programme.title: Winter Walks
programme.desc: Poet laureate Simon Armitage takes a coastal walk along Yorkshires enchanting and historic frontier with the North Sea. Starting in Ravenscar, Simon follows a disused railway line, passing former quarries and brickworks, before walking along the beach from Boggle Hole to the picture-perfect Robin Hoods Bay

programme.title: Christmas University Challenge
programme.sub-title: Durham University v University of York
programme.desc: Alumni of Durham University face graduates of the University of York in the third match of the 2022 festive edition of the academic quiz, with documentary maker Chris Terrill taking the captains chair for Durham, and YouTuber Tom Scott heading the team from York. Hosted by Jeremy Paxman

programme.title: The Magical World of Moss
programme.desc: A visit to moss-covered landscapes in Japan, Iceland, France and Denmark where scientists are investigating the astonishing properties and potential of these plants. Mosses evolved from oceanic algae that emerged onto the land 450 million years ago, and have become a main source of oxygen for the evolving planet - yet science is only beginning to understand the secrets and the possibilities they hold

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Revisiting the African lions that learned to prey on elephants in the drought-ridden Kalahari Desert, and catching up with the pride during the rainy season. Imogen Stubbs narrates

programme.title: Live Snooker: UK Championship
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine presents further coverage of the evening session on day five at York Barbican, featuring two second-round matches, played over the best of 11 frames. Jack Lisowski claimed a 6-4 victory over Ali Carter at this stage last year, and 2022 champion Mark Allen came back from 4-2 down to prevail by the same scoreline against Wu Yize. With commentary and analysis from Steve Davis, John Parrott, Ken Doherty, Dennis Taylor and Stephen Hendry, and reports from Shabnam Younus-Jewell

programme.title: The Tenant of Wildfell Hall
programme.desc: Three-part drama series based on Anne Brontes novel. A painter and her son arrive at Wildfell Hall, fuelling rumours among villagers that she is harbouring a dark secret. Lonely and withdrawn, she is befriended by a local farmer - but will she trust him enough to reveal the truth about her past? Starring Tara Fitzgerald, Toby Stephens, Rupert Graves and Pam Ferris

programme.title: The Tenant of Wildfell Hall
programme.desc: Helen gives Gilbert her journal, explaining her life story from her first meeting with the dashing Arthur Huntingdon when, at the age of 18, she was eager for excitement and romance. Starring Tara Fitzgerald, Toby Stephens, Pam Ferris and Rupert Graves

programme.title: The Tenant of Wildfell Hall
programme.desc: Helen and her son Arthur are forced to leave Wildfell as a mysterious coach arrives at the hall, while Gilbert reads her diary and learns of her years of misery and neglect at the hands of Huntingdon. Final part of the adaptation of Anne Brontes classic, starring Tara Fitzgerald, Rupert Graves and Toby Stephens.

programme.title: Birth of the British Novel
programme.desc: Author and critic Henry Hitchings explores the evolution of the novel in 18th-century Britain, and offers his view that it was a time of cultural revolution. He examines the social and political history of the period, uses paintings by great artists to illustrate scenes from key novels, and explains how major genres from light entertainment for female readers to political thrillers were perfected. Along the way, he meets authors including Martin Amis, Will Self, Tom McCarthy and Jenny Uglow

programme.title: The Magical World of Moss
programme.desc: A visit to moss-covered landscapes in Japan, Iceland, France and Denmark where scientists are investigating the astonishing properties and potential of these plants. Mosses evolved from oceanic algae that emerged onto the land 450 million years ago, and have become a main source of oxygen for the evolving planet - yet science is only beginning to understand the secrets and the possibilities they hold

programme.title: The Lost Libraries of Timbuktu
programme.desc: Aminatta Forna presents a documentary examining the literary tradition of Timbuktu in Mali, where hundreds of thousands of manuscripts have come to light in recent years. From the 13th to the 16th centuries, the city was a renowned seat of learning, and its black African scholars were revered throughout the Islamic world

programme.title: Winter Walks
programme.desc: Yorkshire peer Baroness Sayeeda Warsi takes time out from her political life to seek peace and calm in the Dales. On her ramble through Wharfedale, the former government minister meets villagers in Kettlewell, a farmer preparing for lambing and a long-distance fell runner

programme.title: Christmas University Challenge
programme.sub-title: Exeter College, Oxford v Queen Mary University, London
programme.desc: Exeter College, Oxford and Queen Mary University, London are represented by distinguished alumni in the fourth heat of the 2022 Christmas University Challenge. Newsreader Reeta Chakrabarti and environmental writer Lucy Siegle are hoping to lead their respective teams to a place in the semi-finals. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions

programme.title: Dame Judi Dench: My Passion for Trees
programme.desc: The actress meets experts and historians to discover how embedded trees are in Britains history and how important they are to its future. Filmed over the course of a year, this programme offers a study of the changing seasons and their effect on Surrey, the most wooded county in Britain, which Judi has called home for the last 30 years

programme.title: Live Snooker: UK Championship
programme.desc: Hazel Irvine presents further coverage of the evening session on day six at York Barbican, featuring two second-round matches, played over the best of 11 frames. Then reigning world champion Kyren Wilson dominated his contest at this stage last year, prevailing 6-2 against Chris Wakelin. The encounter between Jak Jones and Michael Holt was considerably closer, with Holt eventually prevailing 6-5. With commentary and analysis from Steve Davis, John Parrott, Ken Doherty, Dennis Taylor and Stephen Hendry, and reports from Shabnam Younus-Jewell

programme.title: Quartet
programme.desc: Three former opera singers prepare for their annual concert to mark Verdis birthday and raise funds for their retirement home. However, this year, a famous diva has joined the group, and her history with the others threatens the performance. Comedy drama, directed by Dustin Hoffman and starring Maggie Smith, Billy Connolly, Tom Courtenay, Pauline Collins and Michael Gambon

programme.title: Wogan
programme.sub-title: Pauline Collins, Simon Callow, Esther Rantzen and Desmond Wilcox
programme.desc: Terry Wogan speaks to actress Pauline Collins, actor Simon Callow, journalist Esther Rantzen and TV producer Desmond Wilcox. First broadcast 8 January 1988

programme.title: Capability Browns Unfinished Garden
programme.desc: Bunny Guinness tries to carry out the 18th-century English landscape designers plans for his own garden in Fenstanton, Cambridgeshire. Brown travelled the length and breadth of the country, improving more than 200 of the greatest estates in the land, for some of the most influential people of the day, but the design for his own garden never got off the drawing board

programme.title: Britains Most Fragile Treasure
programme.desc: Janina Ramirez explores the complex history of York Minsters Great East Window, the largest medieval stained-glass window in England. Composed of 311 panels, it was originally designed to tell the complete biblical history of the world from creation to the Last Judgement, and has been compared to Michelangelos work at the Sistine Chapel. The historian closely examines the handiwork of its creator John Thornton, revealing intricate details that would not normally be visible, and follows a project to restore the window to its original glory

programme.title: Winter Walks
programme.desc: Yorkshire peer Baroness Sayeeda Warsi takes time out from her political life to seek peace and calm in the Dales. On her ramble through Wharfedale, the former government minister meets villagers in Kettlewell, a farmer preparing for lambing and a long-distance fell runner

programme.title: Dame Judi Dench: My Passion for Trees
programme.desc: The actress meets experts and historians to discover how embedded trees are in Britains history and how important they are to its future. Filmed over the course of a year, this programme offers a study of the changing seasons and their effect on Surrey, the most wooded county in Britain, which Judi has called home for the last 30 years

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Louise Minchin and Greg Rutherford present the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Julia Somerville, Louise Minchin and Gloria Hunniford tell the story of how a car finance companys mistake led to the credit record of a man from Blackpool being merged with a man from south Wales who shared his name - leading to problems when he applied for a mortgage. Plus, a look at whether deaf movie lovers are being short-changed by cinema chains, and a broadband companys customers who say quitting their contract is far too difficult

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.sub-title: With a Little Help from Some Friends
programme.desc: Martin Roberts and Dion Dublin visit a scrap of land that becomes home to a three-bedroom house in Staffordshire and follow transformations in Liverpool and Torquay

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Christina Trevanion is in Shrewsbury, Shropshire, where she takes a ride on one of Englands oldest and steepest mountainside railways. With Philip Serrell and Izzie Balmer

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Marvellous Miniature Workshop
programme.desc: Sara Cox is joined by craftsman Lee Robinson who recreates Silverwood Colliery in miniature, while ex-miners Reg and Neil share memories of community, hardship and pride in their South Yorkshire pit

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Coppersmith Ian wants to get out of the hobby zone but needs to develop his skills. Crocheter Louise needs to focus her work to be able to go full-time

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Alistair Appleton helps a buyer find a new home in Suffolk, where he also meets a couple who have established a biodiverse wildflower meadow

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.sub-title: Chess Set, Clockwork Cars, Victorian Sewing Table
programme.desc: Nigel Havers meets five more sellers hoping to raises money with a lovingly restored antique chess set, a Victorian sewing table, an oak gong, a piece of Rolls-Royce advertising and a collection of clockwork cars

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Raj Bisram and Briony Harfords antique hunt brings them to Kent. Briony falls for a charming canine portrait that might have a hidden pedigree, Raj goes supersonic with Concorde memorabilia and the pair take a detour to a famous racing circuit

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Stephen Mangan reveals the correct answers and comments on the players scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Clara Amfo and Alex Jones present the magazine show, with celebrity guests and stories of interest from around the UK

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Anthony and Howie are desperate to both keep their secrets as Kim plans her engagement party. However, as loose lips cause big trouble, the event doesnt go to plan. Lilys concern for Jeans mental health intensifies as she struggles in the wake of Freddies departure, and Nigel commences auditions for his film

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: Alfie Boe, Alun Wyn Jones, Ashley Cain, Jodie Ounsley and Noreen Khan compete in the latest heat, each intent on impressing judges Grace Dent and John Torode. Two challenges await and a place in the quarter-finals is for the taking. Theres a familiar face setting the latest brief - 2021 MasterChef finalist Alexina Anatole, who has a passion for pairing ingredients that would ordinarily raise alarm bells. Each contender has one of her recipes that celebrate bitterness, which they need to incorporate into their dish, ensuring every element works in harmony. This is a careful balancing act as one mistake could leave a bitter taste in everyones mouth

programme.title: Shetland
programme.desc: Tosh finally confronts Billy about Robert Tullochs past in the police force, suspecting his mentor was corrupt - a suggestion that Billy angrily rejects. Calder waits anxiously at the hospital for news about Louden, but her guilt eventually prompts her to go after the people responsible for the assault. A new suspect comes to light when a fingerprint at Eadies house is identified. However, Calder and Toshs interrogation of this Lunniswick local takes a surprising turn, revealing a shameful secret

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Plough On!
programme.desc: Documentary following a Co Down mans dream of becoming world ploughing champion - from the fields of Northern Ireland to a shot at glory in the Czech Republic. Andrew Gill lives in Dromore, a ploughing heartland steeped in Ulster-Scots heritage and the birthplace of Harry Ferguson, the inventor whose tractor revolutionised farming worldwide. Andrews story is made all the more extraordinary by the fact that, at just 23, he was diagnosed with leukaemia. With the unwavering support of his family, Andrew overcame the disease and went on to represent Northern Ireland at world championships in America, Ireland, Latvia and Estonia

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Action from the midweek Premier League matches, including Arsenal v Brentford at Emirates Stadium and Liverpool v Sunderland at Anfield. Title-challenging Arsenal hosted their fellow Londoners, who held them to a 1-1 draw here last term, and champions Liverpool took on a Sunderland side that have impressed so far this term. Plus, Brighton and Hove Albion v Aston Villa, Burnley v Crystal Palace, Wolverhampton Wanderers v Nottingham Forest, Leeds United v Chelsea, Bournemouth v Everton, Fulham v Manchester City and Newcastle United v Tottenham Hotspur

programme.title: Alan Carrs Picture Slam
programme.desc: Alan Carr hosts this game show in which three teams of contestants have to identify a board full of images, with a chance of winning up to £10,000 if they know them all. This episodes contenders are three couples from Bedfordshire, Grimsby, and Dunfermline

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Sara Cox and Greg Rutherford host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical discussion and expert advice for viewers

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Julia Somerville, Gloria Hunniford and Louise Minchin reveal how criminals are using artificial intelligence to create deepfake online videos of celebrities and public figures to try to get their hands on peoples cash. Plus, the Lancashire man whose savings account was raided by fraudsters who obtained his security passcode

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin is at a three-bedroom house in the West Midlands that has some worrying cracks and Martel Maxwell visits a mid-terrace house in Durham. Martin Roberts investigates a heating mystery in a one bedroom flat in Dartford, Kent

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Roo Irvine hosts the latest contest at the Antiques, Vintage and Collectors Fair in Detling, Kent. With expert help on hand from Irita Marriott and Nick Hall, the reds and the blues go head to head to see who can buy the most profitable items to sell at auction. Roo also finds out how retro computers are now becoming collectable

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Marvellous Miniature Workshop
programme.desc: Sara Cox meets Julia, a jazz singer with powerful memories of Readings Central Club - a place of music, domino tournaments and Caribbean pride, where her father was a local legend. With the building now abandoned, Ethan Goodbody faces the challenge of reviving its spirit in miniature. His intention is to bring back the stage, the iconic mural and the heartbeat of a vanished community

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Birmingham cleaner Rachel has only been creating jewellery from clay for a couple of years to help with her anxiety. She soon fell in love with the craft and wishes to leave her job to devote herself to it. However, mentor Rachel Jeffery is concerned that her lack of confidence is holding her back by under-pricing and under-selling herself. Wiltshire coppersmith and sculptor Roy has recently given up his day job to commit to his craft. Hes got the skills, but Dom Chinea and mentor Ian Gill have spotted ways he can refine and speed up his work to help boost his profits

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A couple from Kent want to head west to Cornwall to house-hunt for a property where they can create a wellness retreat, and Jules Hudson is just the man to help them find it. Taking a break from the search, Jules hopes to catch a glimpse of a recently released family of beavers

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Nigel Havers presents as dealers bid for an etagere - a tiered table for display, a German pendant light with textured glass lampshades, some napkin clips found in a charity shop in Canada, a Victorian spinning wheel and an exercise bike

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.sub-title: If You Go Down to the Woods Today
programme.desc: Raj Bisram and Briony Harford continue exploring the shops of Kent in search of hidden gems. Raj is hoping for the sweet smell of success with one fragrant find and gets all nostalgic over a classic toy brand that takes him back. Bee also has transportation in mind and splashes out on a Victorian vehicle with an equine charm - though it might just blow her budget. Their journey takes a wild turn with a woodland detour, where they meet some of the countys furriest residents, including one very brave bear with a story to tell

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Stephen Mangan joins Alexander Armstrong to co-host the quiz, in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the most obscure answers

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and JB Gill host the live magazine show featuring a mixture of celebrity chat and stories of interest

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Lauren and Zoes friendship deepens as they discuss the latters long-lost son, but later, as they head back to Laurens place, someone is watching them from the shadows. George makes an effort to forgive, and Billy is given a mission by Lexi

programme.title: Celebrity Race Across the World
programme.desc: The penultimate leg of the race is the longest so far, with the teams travelling from the islands of Bocas del Toro on northern Panamas Caribbean coast, to Medellín, Colombias second largest city. Standing in their way is the notorious and dangerous Darien Gap - their only option is to bypass it by sea, enduring a lengthy, arduous and costly boat journey, putting their dwindling budgets under pressure. On reaching the final country of the race, teams are confronted with another challenge to overcome - a heightened security risk on the route to Medellín

programme.title: Celebrity MasterChef
programme.desc: The stage is set for the last quarter-final, meaning the stars need to use every trick in their recipe book to stand any chance of progressing. For the first time the celebrities working in pairs, with judges Grace Dent and John Torode arming each duo with a recipe. They must deliver two identical portions of that dish, but only one member of each duo has access to their recipe. Then, once again flying solo, the contestants deliver their best two-course menu to the judges and former series alumni Craig Doyle, Amy Walsh and Kadeena Cox

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: The View
programme.desc: Mark Carruthers presents a review of the weeks political news, including reports on the latest events at Stormont and Westminster. Plus, comment and analysis with studio guests

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate from the Kent port of Dover, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: A panel of BBC journalists hosts a weekly round-up from Westminster, delivering the usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip about the biggest stories in politics

programme.title: Michael McIntyres The Wheel
programme.desc: The comedian hosts the game show in which contestants answer questions with the aid of celebrity experts - aware that one wrong answer means someone else gets a chance. Advising the contestants are Rachel Riley, Ellie Simmonds, Richard Madeley, David Walliams, Adam Hills, Fatiha El-Ghorri, Vogue Williams and Spencer Matthews

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Rattus enlists the help of Richie - the Horrible Histories songwriter - to help him present a special song-filled show by making every one of Rattus bits a song too

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: Loo Man provides a guided tour through some of historys grossest things, from bottom complaints to snot, bird muck and breaking wind

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Festive edition from 2008 in which Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May embark on one of the most spectacular road trips they have ever attempted. Arriving in Vietnam, they are challenged to travel the entire length of the country in just eight days. First they must buy suitable transport for the journey, and despite having several million Dong in their pockets, this proves more difficult than they expected, especially in one of the most expensive car markets in the world

programme.title: Dating Apps: The Inside Story
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the Match Group, the corporation behind some of the worlds biggest online dating apps, and revealing the duplicity at the heart of the matchmaking services on offer. Surveys consistently find the majority of users are seeking long-term and serious relationships. However, this programme reveals how they have been sold a lie, and are manipulated in the pursuit of profit

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: After the success of his comeback fight, Tommys road to redemption hits a major setback - his hand is injured again and needs eight weeks total rest before doctors will know if he can fight again. The last time he couldnt train, his life spiralled out of control, so now Tommy throws himself into a frenzy of activity - a TV appearance on The Wheel, family days out with Bambi and a final push to finish the home he hopes Molly and Bambi will soon return to

programme.title: Tommy: The Good. The Bad. The Fury
programme.desc: Tommys recovery is back on track after he and John put his hand to the test. The pair are training again, and the search for Tommys next opponent begins. Eager to make the most of family time, Tommy splashes out on a £90,000 motor home for family trips with Molly and Bambi and takes his mother out for lunch and a long-overdue catch-up. Tommy reveals that John has had a recent health scare, so to cheer him up, father and son take their very different caravans to a local steam fair

programme.title: Ashley Cain: Into the Danger Zone
programme.desc: Ashley heads to Sweden where he joins police at the front line of the ongoing gang war and meets with gang bosses in underground car parks. As trouble expands throughout the country, children as young as 13 are taking weapons and justice into their own hands, a photojournalist shows him their documentation of the murder scenes before he meets with a top gang leader for a training session involving pistol target practice in the dead of night

programme.title: Ashley Cain: Into the Danger Zone
programme.desc: Ashley heads to the Philippines to find out if joining a gang is the only way to survive in the slum districts of the capital Manila. From street kids with few choices to families making homes among the graves of the citys notorious North Cemetery, Ashley discovers how gang life has changed in the Philippines and what factors still drive young men to join them

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.sub-title: Top Gear Patagonia Special - Part One
programme.desc: The first half of a two-part special, the filming of which caused controversy in Argentina because of a registration plate that drew links to the Falklands War. Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May take three used V8-engined sports cars on a gruelling road trip covering 1,600 miles through Patagonia. Their chosen vehicles are the Porsche 928, Lotus Esprit and Ford Mustang, which are subjected to rigours beyond the scope of their original designs - from tackling swamps and crossing deserts to navigating forests, beaches and ski slopes. Their destination is Ushuaia, the worlds southernmost city, where they hope to stage a game of car football against Argentina

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.sub-title: Top Gear Patagonia Special - Part Two
programme.desc: The conclusion of the two-part special in which Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May take three used, V8-engined sports cars on a gruelling road trip covering 1,600 miles through Patagonia to the worlds southernmost city. Having encountered stunning landscapes, mechanical mishaps and dreadful roads on their journey through Argentina, the trios adventure is brought to a dramatic climax by a terrifying turn of events

programme.desc: Giovanna and Baby Bear welcome little ones Alfie, Charlie, Ollie, River, Araiya and their grown-ups to The Baby Club. Parents, carers and their babies at home are invited to join in with all the fun activities too! Inside Giovannas bag are numbered building blocks, and all the parents and little ones have different objects and toys that are themed around numbers. These are explored through discovery, play, song and story. Grown-ups at home are encouraged to take part by hiding safe, baby-appropriate number-themed objects and toys inside a fabric bag or pillowcase for them to reveal and explore with their baby! The traditional childrens nursery rhyme One, Two, Buckle My Shoe features, as does a story involving Baby Bear, and viewers at home show how theyve been exploring numbers too. The Action Song gets everyone moving about, before some calm time with sensory bubbles and the Goodbye Song.

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Carrie uses her extra income to hire a maid, making Doug feel so jealous that he decides to employ his own domestic help - in the form of Spences mother Veronica. Unfortunately, she proves more of a liability than an asset around the house. American comedy, starring Kevin James

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug decides to pursue his dream of becoming a bartender, but Carrie is unimpressed with his plans. Meanwhile, Arthur also attempts a career change, entering the dangerous world of politics. American comedy, starring Kevin James

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: The Heffernans begin attending the gym with The Incredible Hulk star Lou Ferrigno and his wife, but Doug is less than impressed with the arrangement and makes a secret pact with the actor that enables him to relax instead of working out. Kevin James stars

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Robert bumps into his ex-wife, and considers rekindling the relationship. Meanwhile, Frank tells Amy the story of how the pair split up in the first place

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Part one of two. Marie surprises everyone by arranging a trip to Rome for the whole family, but all Ray can do is complain. Comedy, starring Ray Romano and Doris Roberts

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Part two of two. As the familys Roman holiday continues, Robert falls in love with sultry local beauty Stefania (Alex Meneses), who works in an ice-cream shop

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles takes dancing lessons in preparation for a posh society ball, but his date falls ill at the last minute, so he asks Daphne to go with him instead. Comedy, starring David Hyde Pierce and Jane Leeves

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: The Show Where Diane Comes Back
programme.desc: Diane visits Seattle for the opening night of her new play, which turns out to be a mixed blessing for Frasier. Although hurt over being jilted, he still harbours feelings for her - but they disappear once he attends the dress rehearsal. Shelley Long guest stars

programme.title: Frasier
programme.sub-title: A Word to the Wise Guy
programme.desc: A shady character helps the Crane brothers get Maris out of a spot of legal trouble - then demands they return the favour by persuading his girlfriend to marry him. Comedy, guest starring Harris Yulin, with Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Niles is left jumping for joy by an exciting proposal from Maris, while Frasier suggests the family tries something different to mark the leap year. However, all his efforts end in disaster. Comedy, starring Kelsey Grammer and David Hyde Pierce

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz visit a petrol station that has been transformed into a home, where they brave a collection that sends a chill up the spine

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: At Chateau du Puits es Pratx, Tim and Sasha prepare for the final wedding of the season. A couple who married there 10 years ago are returning with their children for a Christmas theyll never forget. At Chateau des Vieilles Vignes, Nick and Nicole are planning a Christmas party but they dont have a floor. With concrete waiting to harden, theres just 24 hours before the party begins. Meanwhile, in the Dordogne, Tim and Krys have big plans for an unforgettable treat for Tims son Owen, while also creating the perfect hot chocolate

programme.title: Christmas At
programme.desc: Seasonal preparations at Palladian stately home Holkham Hall, which is surrounded by a walled park, a 25,000-acre estate and 11 miles of north Norfolk coastline. This year, the Countess of Leicester, announces there is no theme to Christmas and, instead, each state room will boast its own eclectic identity, though the great drawing room becomes a tribute to the late Queen with a Jubilee-inspired red, white and blue tree of gifts. Lady Leicester leads a design team in a frenetic rush to decorate a quarter of a mile of grand saloons, dining rooms and marble halls to pull off a festive stately experience like no other

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Colin Murray and Rachel Riley host the words-and-numbers game where contestants pit their wits against the clock. Harry Aikines-Aryeetey joins Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Lee Juggurnauth assists retirees Steve and Jackie from Oxfordshire, who want to find a holiday home in Guardamar del Segura, south-east Spain, that they can enjoy with their family and friends. Lee showcases five attractive properties within their budget of £80,000

programme.title: Kirsties Handmade Christmas
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp offers two more weeks of festive tips on how to have a stylish Christmas without breaking the bank. A batch of bakers compete to win Kirsties cake decorating trophy, theres advice on using pinecones to make cute Christmas characters and a look back at a favourite jewellery make from the archive

programme.title: The Great BandB Challenge
programme.desc: Paul and Justins garden party falls flat, while Jo and Guy are forced to improvise when there are issues in the market. Nicole and Brett try to cook an Indian feast using an international mix of ingredients

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Retired couple Debra and Gordon are looking for the perfect holiday home in the southern Spanish city of Torrevieja. This former fishing village has grown to become one of Spains most popular resorts, with acres of beautiful countryside and miles of spectacular coastlines hugging popular towns, villages and resorts. While Debra is keen on apartments, Gordon would love a townhouse for their budget of £120,000. Laura Hamilton shows them a selection of places that satisfy both of their desires, from a sea-view apartment and a property with a gym and a sauna to a tantalising townhouse

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc: People affected by cancer share their personal and moving stories, in a series of short films in aid of Stand Up To Cancer

programme.title: Grand Designs: House of the Year
programme.desc: The search for the House of the Year 2025 continues with a home in Bannau Brycheiniog, the Brecon Beacons, built from sandstone quarried in the mountains it overlooks. Also, a project that used modern methods to reinvent Norwichs medieval brick tradition and a Suffolk property where handmade brick and Douglas fir beams combine in a striking cruciform design. Finally, an 18th-century Essex barn brought back to life beam-by-beam, its historic frame repaired with seasoned oak using centuries-old techniques

programme.title: The Sycamore Gap Mystery
programme.desc: In September 2023, Northumberlands Sycamore Gap tree was cut down by vandals in the dead of night. The felling of this celebrated landmark, which had famously stood in a remote nook of Hadrians Wall for more than a century, provoked outrage, disbelief and grief among the public. This two-part documentary tells the story of the police investigation that followed, from the first 999 calls to the breakthroughs that led to the arrests of friends Adam Carruthers and Daniel Graham, and reveals the twists and turns of one of the most shocking acts of vandalism in recent British history

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics cast their eyes over 2021s biggest Christmas TV shows. Theyll be passing comment on the most talked about hits from the festive season, including Michael McIntyres Christmas Wheel, First Dates at Christmas, Strictly the Real Full Monty, Jamie: Together at Christmas, Love Actually, Worlds Strongest Man, I Can See Your Voice Christmas Special, The Repair Shop at Christmas, Elves, Nigellas Cook, Eat, Repeat, and No Time to Die

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts a hybrid of the comedy panel show and words-and-numbers quiz, as on Jon Richardson and Guz Khan take on guest captain Katherine Ryan and Joe Wilkinson. Mathematician Rachel Riley looks after the letters and numbers, while Alasdair Beckett-King joins lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef tries to help the owners of Iberville Cuisine and Oyster Bar, in the heart of the French Quarter in New Orleans. They want to be reinvigorated before Super Bowl LIX kicks off in the citys Caesars Superdome - and the tourist trade that comes with hosting the biggest sporting event in America

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Toby Bost, the CEO of ONeill Clothing, poses as a contestant on a reality TV show who is trying to win money to open his own surf shop. His aim is to ensure his upcoming US outlets are successful and will beat any similar competition to the number-one spot

programme.title: Double the Money
programme.desc: In the grand final, the contestants have four weeks to turn £10,000 into £20,000 and whoever makes the most money will also win an extra £20,000. As the clock starts ticking, the teams reveal their final ideas and theyre more ambitious than ever. Despite knowing absolutely nothing about cars, one team decided to launch a used car business but after exhausting all their opportunities and with very few sales in sight, they switch course in a desperate attempt to stay in the running. Another team aim to clinch the title using pure hard graft, as they launch a pizza van business and hope to bring home the dough slice by slice. Other teams opt for selling nutritious lunchtime bowls and launching an entire coffee brand. Will the grind pay off? When the time runs out and the clock stops for the final time, the teams return to The Vault, where one pair are crowned the series winners

programme.title: Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc: People affected by cancer share their personal and moving stories, in a series of short films in aid of Stand Up To Cancer

programme.title: Cancer Detectives: Finding the Cures
programme.desc: Neurosurgeon and scientist Richard Mair races to treat patients with deadly brain cancers as part of a world-first clinical trial intended to give patients more time. He analyses patients tumour DNA and rapidly matches them with targeted drugs. It could be the biggest leap forward in brain cancer for 30 years. Taking part in the trial is family man David, whos having brain surgery and tests to discover if he has an aggressive cancer. Amanda was one of the first people to join Richards trial, after discovering that her brain tumour had returned. She prepares to hear the results of some vital tests

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Cumbria is the location for three more couples to demonstrate their cooking and hosting skills, kicking off with teachers Rory and Sam, who serve up dishes inspired by Europe. Day two sees Sarka and Paul lay on a Czech menu, but the massive portions defeat everyone - except the ever-hungry Rory. Finally, its the turn of John and Sally with their retro 1980s evening. Which couple will win the cash prize of £1,000?

programme.title: Sunday Brunch
programme.desc: Highlights of the food and chat show, with Tim Lovejoy and Simon Rimmer

programme.title: Kirstie and Phils Love It or List It
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet newlyweds Nikki and Andy Taylor-Myers in Northampton, who have recently merged households and are unhappy in their cluttered terrace. Property services manager Andy is desperate to stay in their home, but drama and support teacher Nikki has reached boiling point and wants a fresh start

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Carrie reminisces about why she chose to marry Doug, but also learns some uncomfortable truths, while Danny falls for Holly after his girlfriend leaves him

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug bumps into his erstwhile football coach while delivering a parcel to his old high school, and Arthur loses his senses of sight, hearing and speech when his eye drops go missing. Comedy, guest starring Burt Reynolds with Kevin James and Jerry Stiller

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Carrie is depressed about celebrating her 35th birthday, so Doug asks builders to wolf whistle at her to boost her ego. Meanwhile, Arthur searches for the ideal gift for his daughter. American comedy, starring Kevin James, Leah Remini and Jerry Stiller

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Marie and Frank accidentally crash their car through the wall of Rays house, causing a bitter family dispute - and forcing Debra into the role of peacemaker. Comedy, starring Ray Romano and Patricia Heaton

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Robert believes Amy is the woman of his dreams and decides to tell her the truth about Joanne and Stefania, but she is so shocked by the confession that she refuses to take him back

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Ray accidentally kills Allys pet hamster while the kids are away from home for the weekend, so Debra insists they give it a dignified funeral. Comedy, starring Ray Romano

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Disgruntled to learn his favourite table at Cafe Nervosa has been commandeered by a rude fellow customer, Frasier resorts to physical violence to reclaim it - but later regrets losing his temper

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Martin agrees to a game of chess against Frasier - who keeps losing successive rematches but has trouble accepting defeat graciously. Kelsey Grammer and John Mahoney star

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: Egos inflate to record proportions as the Crane brothers clash during a court battle to decide the mental competence of an eccentric millionaire. Guest starring Donald OConnor

programme.title: Frasier
programme.desc: The shrink falls head over heels for an policewoman, unaware she finds his dad a much more interesting proposition. Comedy, guest starring Malcolm in the Middles Jane Kaczmarek

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Expert buyers Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz hunt down hidden treasures and valuable relics across the USA, uncovering incredible artefacts and captivating stories of American life and history. A lead on an ultra-rare Volkswagen Beetle turns out to be a true barn find, but itll take a heavy metal move to bring it home

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: Before their annual Christmas soiree at Château Trois Cloches, Chris and Jolyon plan to transform their hallway. Theyll need to work harder than Santas elves to pull this off. At Château du Puits es Pratx, its the day of the big wedding. However, with flowers, food and photographs to organise, theres lots to do before Tim and Sasha can say I do

programme.title: Christmas At
programme.desc: Part one of two. A behind-the-scenes look at life in Highclere Castle - the setting of the popular television series and film Downton Abbey - as they deck their halls and prepare to celebrate Christmas in their own unique way. The programme follows the small team of dedicated staff who are tasked with creating seasonal cheer in the castle, as they race to get everything prepared in time to welcome small groups of guests for guided tours and tea, as well as a virtual gin cocktail party hosted by the Earl and Countess of Carnarvon

programme.title: Countdown
programme.desc: Contestants race against the clock to pit their wits against words and numbers. Colin Murray, Rachel Riley and Susie Dent host, with sprinter Harry Aikines-Aryeetey in Dictionary Corner

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jean Johansson is in Puglia in southern Italy to help teacher Wendy find her dream holiday home, which one day she thinks may become her permanent home. Wendy wants a two or three-bedroom villa and has a budget of £200,000 to invest

programme.title: Kirsties Handmade Christmas
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp holds a handmade gift competition, the expert judge demonstrates how to make a screen-printed shopping bag, and Kirstie recycles discarded decorations into wreaths. A craftsman who works wonders with wood shares his secrets when it comes to the perfect wooden decorations

programme.title: The Great BandB Challenge
programme.desc: The latest challenge is to host a happening. Paul and Justin get arty with a sip-and-paint event, and Jo and Guys pizza-and-petanque party gets competitive. Meanwhile, a major housekeeping issue threatens Nicole and Bretts place in the competition

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sisters Ros and Elizabeth want to retire together to their dream home near Bergerac in France. The Dordogne is famous for its wine, warm summers, castles and green forests. Plus, on the banks of the river, Bergeracs old town offers charming cafes and shops for locals and tourists alike. Lee Juggurnauth shows Ros and Elizabeth five options for their maximum budget of £350,000, from a grand country home and picture-perfection to a place ticking boxes by the minute

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc: People affected by cancer share their personal and moving stories. Morgan was a happy little boy from Swansea who loved football, cars and his family. When he was two years old, he was diagnosed with a rare form of cancer linked to a genetic condition that affects just one in one million people. Further testing revealed that his dad and little sister also carry the same mutation. His close relatives share their story

programme.title: Kirsties Handmade Christmas
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp is back with her much-loved Christmas crafting suggestions. This year its all about sharing the load with family and friends, so the host once again enrols her goddaughter to get stuck into all things paper crafting. Plus, a visit to one of Kirsties favourite antique shops to gather inspiration for a Christmas party table and ideas for handcrafted decorations

programme.title: The Sycamore Gap Mystery
programme.desc: The conclusion of a two-part documentary recounting the September 2023 attack on Northumberlands iconic Sycamore Gap tree, which had famously stood in a remote nook of Hadrians Wall. After its deliberately felling, a complex police investigation ensued in an effort to get justice for the local community and the trees countless number of outraged fans across the world. With exclusive access to Northumbria Police, this documentary tells the extraordinary story of this headline-grabbing crime

programme.title: Cancer Detectives: Finding the Cures
programme.desc: The work of Manchester-based professor Caroline Dive, who is developing innovative blood tests to detect cancer, well before its visible on a scan. She is looking for tiny fragments of cancer DNA in the blood, which is comparable to searching for a needle in a haystack. Her innovative tests will also give clues on how to treat cancer, and in some cases cure. Taking part in her clinical trials are mechanic Lee, a medical mystery as doctors cant find where his cancer started, and Damian, who hopes to discover if his recent skin cancer will come back so he can move on with family life

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: Both of the Great North Air Ambulances helicopters are dispatched to help a critically injured father and his two young sons, following a car collision in Cockermouth. The crew from Thames Valley Air Ambulance head to Bracknell, where Martin is having breathing difficulties. Plus, in Stanford-le-Hope, gardener Graham has a nasty open ankle fracture after falling off a ladder

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows including Stranger Things, Strictly Come Dancing, Celebrity Scam Interceptors, Malice, Songs of Praise, CBeebies Bedtime Stories and Animals on Drugs. Plus, a BBC News report on Christmas decorations

programme.title: Save Yourselves!
programme.desc: A young Brooklyn couple head to a remote upstate cabin to unplug from their phones and reconnect with each other. Blissfully unaware of their surroundings, they are left to their own devices as the planet falls under attack. Sci-fi comedy, starring Sunita Mani, John Reynolds and Ben Sinclair

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef takes on one of his toughest challenges yet, J Willys Bar and Grille in South Bend, Indiana, which has amassed debts of more than $1million. On finding an inexperienced chef serving food from both the freezer and tins, together with service that reduces one customer to tears, Gordon Ramsay orders an overnight deep-clean of the premises and designs a menu to inspire the kitchen staff

programme.title: Stand Up to Cancer
programme.desc: People affected by cancer share their personal and moving stories. Morgan was a happy little boy from Swansea who loved football, cars and his family. When he was two years old, he was diagnosed with a rare form of cancer linked to a genetic condition that affects just one in one million people. Further testing revealed that his dad and little sister also carry the same mutation. His close relatives share their story

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In the Lake District, Paul and Glenda kick off the competition in their static caravan, but eyebrows are raised at his unromantic approach to his relationship. On day two self-confessed gadget geek David and his partner Jane show their competitive side with a confidently presented, well-received meal. Finally outdoorsy twentysomethings Matt and Polly show off their good life approach to cooking with a home-grown feast

programme.title: Sunday Brunch
programme.desc: Tim Lovejoy and Simon Rimmer present highlights from Sunday Brunch

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Colin and Richard from Glasgow love Playa del Ingles in Gran Canaria and have been holidaying there for over 20 years. With retirement approaching, they feel nows the perfect time to buy their dream holiday home there to escape the Scottish winters and spend up to six months of the year in the sunshine. Jean Johansson lines up five potential properties for their budget of £200,000, but will any of them seem the perfect place?

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Dr Hamster judges a pet competition at the playground, but choosing the best entry proves difficult

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: There is a spider in the house and Mummy Pig tells Daddy Pig to get rid of it

programme.desc: The family constructs a tennis court in the back garden and Bart becomes an expert player, much to the annoyance of a jealous Homer. Featuring the guest voices of Venus and Serena Williams, Andre Agassi and Pete Sampras

programme.title: Americas Next Top Model
programme.desc: The final three each shoot video reports on fashion and beauty practices in Morocco. And allegations at a Moroccan wedding-themed photo shoot

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their thoughts on shows including Starstruck, The Piano, You, Rick Steins Cornwall, Stacey Dooley Sleeps Over USA, 24 Hours in AandE, a This Morning feature about the worlds longest tongue and ITV News reporting on cheese. From February 2023

programme.title: First Dates Specials
programme.desc: The restaurant hosts the festive party to end all parties with a programme full of amazing surprises as maitre d Fred and his Christmas Cupids celebrate a year that has seen love blossom into wedding proposals, engagement rings and the very first First Dates baby. Couples Aarron and Ibiba, Doreen and James, Will and Fran and Ajai and Hema all make a welcome return to the place where it all began, while previous participants get another chance to find love

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 19-year-old student Marlie from Yorkshire, who keeps choosing the bad boys - which is driving her mum mad. Theres also 30-year-old Adam, from Bradford. Having previously had his heart broken, he is now looking for a woman with no secrets, and believes that if the contestants are willing to bare all on TV, they probably have nothing to hide

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Penny bond as they miss Leonard, and Howard tries to help Raj get over his break-up with Lucy. Meanwhile, Bernadette and Amy visit an out-of-town biology convention. Comedy about four high-achieving scientists, starring Jim Parsons, Kaley Cuoco and Johnny Galecki

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard returns from his research expedition in the North Sea and undergoes an adjustment period with Sheldon. Howard experiences an unusual emotional reaction as a result of his relationship with his mother. Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Simon Helberg star

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their thoughts on shows including Starstruck, The Piano, You, Rick Steins Cornwall, Stacey Dooley Sleeps Over USA, 24 Hours in AandE, a This Morning feature about the worlds longest tongue and ITV News reporting on cheese. From February 2023

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer begins to believe Ned Flanders may not be so bad after all, and starts hanging around with him - but his friendliness and good cheer are not reciprocated for long

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: A Crisis of Faith and Octopus Aliens
programme.desc: Following a tragic accident in the local community, Marys faith is shaken. Seeing his mother doubt everything she believes, Sheldon becomes an unlikely ally. Comedy, starring Iain Armitage and Zoe Perry

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: A Financial Secret and Fish Sauce
programme.desc: When Sheldons father asks him to keep a secret from Mary, the stress of not being honest drives him to Tams for his first sleepover. Comedy, starring Iain Armitage

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Cameron and Mitchell learn that Lilly has started her periods, so they call in reinforcements to give her advice. Phil tells Luke he recently attended a prenatal class with Haley

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Adam worries that sexual tension may develop between him and his long-time friend Emmy. Beverly is caught reading Ericas diary, and vows to trust her daughter instead of snooping in future. However, her new faith is soon taken advantage of. Comedy, starring Wendi McLendon-Covey and Jeff Garlin

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Barry and Erica join Adam and his friends Emmy, Dana and Chad on a treasure hunt inspired by the Goonies when Pops misplaces some family jewels and Beverly threatens to reorganise his financial affairs if he fails to find them. Comedy, starring Jeff Garlin and Wendi McLendon-Covey

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Calvin hires Grover to work part-time at his business, but soon realises that hes not a good fit. Marty and Necie reconsider their living situation

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.sub-title: Welcome to What Used to Be the Neighbourhood
programme.desc: When Calvins favourite restaurant closes and is replaced by a flashy pet spa, he worries that the community is losing too many small businesses and starts a buy-local campaign

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Calvin weighs the pros and cons of making a major life change. Marty turns to Dave for help dealing with a troubling discovery

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil, Cam and Gloria wind up trapped in the basement of a nursing home when the family look to settle old scores with Becky. Things get awkward when Haley meets Arvins parents

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitch makes a faux pas after sneaking out to a comic book convention with Phil, while Glorias party for Joe is ruined when Donna throws a better one next door

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube
programme.desc: Comedy clips showcasing amusing internet videos featuring sports of the lawnmower, motorcycle and bicycle variety

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef tries to change the fortunes of the Olde Stone Mill restaurant in Tuckahoe, New York, which is struggling to attract customers, leading to debts of nearly $1million. Gordon feels the owner is more interested in his own appearance than how his food tastes and a screaming match ensues

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.sub-title: Call Me When You Get There
programme.desc: Barry is thrilled by the freedom his new driving licence brings, until Beverly insists he sticks to her 10 rules of the road at all times. Meanwhile, Pops refuses to wear an emergency alert bracelet and is forced to call Adam when he suffers a fall. Comedy, starring Wendi McLendon-Covey and Jeff Garlin

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly is determined to make friends with her reserved and softly spoken neighbours, the Kremps, so she bombards them with invitations to a barbecue. Meanwhile, Barry and Erica battle for control of the familys telephone line and beg their parents to get a second one installed. Comedy, starring Wendi McLendon-Covey and Jeff Garlin

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: The Clown Stays in the Picture
programme.desc: Krusty reveals the story of his past in a movie, while Bart and Lisa work as his personal assistants on the film and learn about the early years of their parents relationship

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer takes the kids joyriding in Comic Book Guys car and ends up being taken to court. With the voice of Guillermo Del Toro.

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amys attempts to celebrate her birthday with an intimate night at home are interrupted by the news that Bernadette has gone into labour. However, it transpires that Howard, Raj and Stuart may have rushed the expectant mother to the hospital too early, with Raj having difficulty keeping the gender of the unborn child a secret

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: After spending the holidays apart, the gang get together to hear about Sheldons and Amys trip to his mothers, Leonard and Penny recall their Christmas tree adventure, and Howard and Bernadette open up about their first days as parents

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil takes it hard when Luke gives him the teenage cold shoulder - a day he always knew was coming - so he goes in search of a stand-in son. A dilemma presents itself for Jay when Gloria suspects Joe is allergic to Stella, while Mitchell does some freelance legal work for Claire, an experience he finds rather enlightening

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Valentines Day arrives, which for the Dunphys means their chance to dress up and romance each other as their once-a-year role-play characters Clive and Juliana - although Claire begins to worry that Phil prefers her like this. Meanwhile, Jays romantic plans hit a snag in the sassy form of Glorias sister Sonia, who ends up trying to seduce him, and wires are crossed when Mitch and Cam find themselves in a sticky situation with pal Anders

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon tries to extend his lifespan, concerned he will not be around long enough for his consciousness to be downloaded into a robot body, and the friends encounter Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak (guest starring as himself) at the Cheesecake Factory

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon breaks up with Amy and turns to cats in his search for an alternative to human companionship. However, when he starts to bulk-buy pets, Leonard decides enough is enough and calls for reinforcements to help bring his friend back to his senses. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: An embarrassing secret from Howards past comes to light as he tries to win back Bernadette, while Sheldon and Raj engage in a battle of wills when they have to work in the same office. Guest starring Katee Sackhoff and George Takei

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard is depressed that everyone seems to be paired off except him, and resorts to desperate measures to get a girlfriend. Meanwhile, Sheldon looks for a way out of his relationship with Amy, who wants him to meet her mother. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: A Research Study and Czechoslovakian Wedding Pastries
programme.desc: Dr Sturgis recommends Sheldon and Missy for a university research study on twins. but Mary is unhappy when the test results go to Sheldons head. Comedy, starring Iain Armitage

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: Seven Deadly Sins and a Small Carl Sagan
programme.desc: Mary clashes with Sheldons drama teacher over plans for a Halloween fundraiser for the church. Georgie falls for a rebellious teenage girl that Sheldon is tutoring

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: In an episode set 30 years in the future, Bart and Lisa now have families of their own and decide to spend Christmas with Homer and Marge. However, when they turn to their parents for advice, the pair discover they have more in common with their mother and father than they realised

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: An impassioned video rant by Homer becomes an internet sensation and he is given his own talk show. Before long the lovable oaf is the new voice of American politics and spokesperson for the Gravy Movement - but problems arise when he is given the task of choosing the next Republican nominee

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Amy and Penny use Bernadette to spy on Leonard and Priya after the couple invite her and Howard to dinner. An experimental drug helps Raj overcome his fear of talking to women, but proves more effective than he had expected. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki and Jim Parsons

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Howard decides to tell his mother that he and Bernadette are engaged - but she later collapses, making him fear the shock of the news has caused her to suffer a heart attack. As the gang convenes at the hospital, Sheldons fear of infectious diseases lands him in trouble, while Priya and Penny bond over coffee

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Bernadette receives her PhD, and the friends then tease Howard about being the only one among them who is not a doctor. Meanwhile, Raj becomes Sheldons new flatmate after overhearing Leonard and Priya engaging in a Star Trek bedroom fantasy. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kunal Nayyar

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny worries about the consequences of spending the night with Raj, and Leonards reaction confirms her worst fears. Meanwhile, Sheldon is more interested in the upcoming paintball competition, and tries to refocus the boys attentions as they argue over the previous evenings activities. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons, Johnny Galecki and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: The Boy Who Knew Too Much
programme.desc: Mayor Quimbys nephew is wrongly accused of assault, presenting Bart with a dilemma - if he volunteers the information that would clear the lads name, he risks being expelled from school for playing truant

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The family celebrates Maggies birthday. Bart steals Homers wallet to pay for an Itchy and Scratchy souvenir, and Grandma Bouvier is swept off her feet by Grampa - but Mr Burns provides romantic competition, convinced she is the woman for him

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer agrees to a request from Mel Gibson to help re-edit his latest film, a remake of the James Stewart classic Mr Smith Goes to Washington - and shocks the studio executives by adding a lot more action scenes

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: The family heads to New York after Bart hears his ex-girlfriend Mary Spuckler (Zooey Deschanel) is living there. But once he arrives, the spiky-haired youngster revisits a few more of his old flames - voiced by Anne Hathaway, Sarah Michelle Gellar, Natalie Portman and Sarah Silverman - while Lisa and Marge take in the local culture

programme.title: Americas Next Top Model
programme.desc: Filming a TV commercial causes the two remaining contestants to question their talents, but spirits are quickly restored when Mollys parents arrive and Brittani shares a call with her ill mother. The final catwalk challenge sees the girls modelling Vivienne Westwood, but a sudden ankle injury threatens Brittanis chance of victory, and they are told they must each receive a radical makeover

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics give their opinions on Coronation Street, Love Island, Sex Actually with Alice Levine, Starstruck, Cheat, Dancing on Ice, and Catfish UK. From March 2023

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics review Jamies £1 Wonders, Married at First Sight Australia, Only Connect, Sex Actually with Alice Levine, Fall, Naked and Afraid, BBC News and ITV News. First shown in March 2023

programme.title: First Dates Specials
programme.desc: Blonde bombshell Dominique meets mortgage advisor Buddy, hoping he will match her conversational prowess and be willing to accept her just the way she is - loud laugh included. Self-confessed softy Issac attempts to get over being homeless for three years following his mother death by meeting up with feisty single mum Maya. Elsewhere, retired nurse Sue has a penchant for Jeremy Corbyns look and anticipates retired electrician Peter will fit the bill, and Disney superfan James hopes his date will be a fairy-tale romance worthy of his favourite films

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: The friends compete in a scavenger hunt designed by Raj to test their scientific knowledge and life skills, but the game brings out the best and worst in everyone. As the hunt progresses, Howard and Amy begin to bond over their shared musical tastes, while Penny and Sheldon work together as a team and Bernadette becomes fiercely competitive

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon introduces Amy to Raiders of the Lost Ark - one of his favourite films - and is distraught when she ends up pointing out a plot hole that ruins the whole story. Meanwhile, Leonard realises he can manipulate Penny into feeling sorry for him when his mother publishes a reveal-all book about his childhood problems. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons and Johnny Galecki

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Twenty six-year-old psychology student Alesia is tired of meeting boys and is now seeking someone more emotionally mature than her previous partners. Next up is Louise from London, who has travelled the world and been on over 200 dates, but is still no closer to finding her soul mate. Anna Richardson assists both singletons, inviting them to choose their favourite partner from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time until fully nude. The contenders then don their glad rags to enjoy a date together

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart wins a competition and becomes the lucky owner of a fully grown elephant, which proceeds to eat his hard-up family out of house and home

programme.title: Young Sheldon
programme.sub-title: A Research Study and Czechoslovakian Wedding Pastries
programme.desc: Dr Sturgis recommends Sheldon and Missy for a university research study on twins. but Mary is unhappy when the test results go to Sheldons head. Comedy, starring Iain Armitage

programme.sub-title: Seven Deadly Sins and a Small Carl Sagan
programme.desc: Mary clashes with Sheldons drama teacher over plans for a Halloween fundraiser for the church. Georgie falls for a rebellious teenage girl that Sheldon is tutoring

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitch, Cam and Phil crash Jays annual hiking trip to find an elusive eagle after Gloria asks them to keep an eye on him, while Alex, Claire and Haley plan a baby shower

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Murray struggles to get Adam interested in hockey, but he doesnt enjoy the sport and fakes enthusiasm to please his father. Beverly tries to help Erica prepare for her college entrance exams, but her plans threaten to backfire when she does the job too well

programme.title: The Goldbergs
programme.desc: Beverly replaces Murrays favourite chair with a new one without consulting him first, causing him to go on the warpath. Adam becomes tired of being picked on during the bus ride to school, but soon comes to regret enlisting Barry to help fend off the bully

programme.title: The Neighborhood
programme.desc: Calvin and Tina decide to take the honeymoon they never had, in Madrid. Dave and Gemma team up with Malcolm and Marty on a project to surprise Calvin when he returns

programme.desc: Jamie and Stuart race to a supermarket where a man has collapsed doing his Christmas food shopping, while Dan and Holly visit the home of a familiar patient with chronic emphysema
