As his behaviour becomes increasingly stranger, she begins to fear she is being tricked and resolves to discover the truth for herself. Thriller, starring Mary Elizabeth Winstead and John Goodman

programme.title: Constantine
programme.desc: Exorcist John Constantine is cursed with the ability to see spirits stalking the Earth, and grudgingly takes on the forces of evil, hoping his actions will earn him a place in heaven. However, he is told he has terminal cancer and time for salvation is running out - unless a policewoman investigating her twin sisters death can find the key to saving his soul. Supernatural thriller, starring Keanu Reeves, Rachel Weisz and Tilda Swinton

programme.title: Men in Black
programme.desc: A streetwise cop is enlisted by a top-secret government force dedicated to policing alien visitors to Earth, teaming up with a veteran agent just as a body-swapping extraterrestrial giant insect begins a reign of terror throughout New York City. Sci-fi comedy, starring Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones, Linda Fiorentino, Rip Torn and Vincent DOnofrio

programme.title: Men in Black II
programme.desc: Agent J investigates the unauthorised landing of a spacecraft and discovers a malevolent alien disguised as a lingerie model is on the verge of destroying humanity. His only hope of stopping her diabolical plot is to restore the memory of his retired partner K - but his former mentor takes more than a little convincing. Sci-fi comedy sequel, directed by Barry Sonnenfeld, starring Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones, Rosario Dawson, Lara Flynn Boyle, Johnny Knoxville, Rip Torn and Tony Shalhoub

programme.title: Men in Black 3
programme.desc: An alien criminal escapes from a prison on the moon and goes back in time on a mission of revenge, changing the course of history. Agent J of the top-secret Earth defence organisation follows him back to 1969, and joins forces with a younger version of his mentor Agent K to set things right. Sci-fi comedy sequel, starring Will Smith, Josh Brolin and Tommy Lee Jones

programme.title: Children of Men
programme.desc: In a future blighted by mass infertility, the human race is one generation from extinction and the world has plunged into chaos. In a totalitarian Britain, a jaded former activist tries to protect the first woman to become pregnant in nearly 20 years. However, a militant underground group plans to use her for its own ends. Thriller, starring Clive Owen, Michael Caine and Julianne Moore

programme.title: Blade
programme.desc: A half-vampire possesses all the strengths inherent in bloodsuckers with none of their weaknesses, and is determined to wipe the monsters from the face of the Earth. However, he faces a deadly new threat in a renegade vampire who is close to decoding an ancient prophecy that will allow him to repopulate the world with his kind. Action thriller, starring Wesley Snipes, Stephen Dorff and Kris Kristofferson

programme.title: Battleship
programme.desc: A reckless slacker joins the Navy, hoping to win the respect of his girlfriends father, a stern admiral. He and his shipmates are put to the ultimate test as part of a force of vessels that must battle an invading fleet of powerful alien spaceships. Sci-fi adventure, starring Taylor Kitsch, Liam Neeson and Alexander Skarsgard

programme.title: Unhinged
programme.desc: Following a minor road-rage incident, single mother Rachel is terrorised by a seemingly mentally ill stranger. She finds herself and everyone she loves the target of a man who feels invisible and is looking to make one last mark upon the world by teaching her a series of deadly lessons. Psychological thriller, starring Russell Crowe and Caren Pistorius

programme.title: Caddo Lake
programme.desc: The disappearance of an eight-year-old girl ties together a series of past deaths and disappearances, as well as bringing the truth about a broken familys history into the light. Thriller written and directed by Logan George and Celine Held, starring Dylan OBrien and Eliza Scanlen

programme.title: The Bikeriders
programme.desc: Truck driver Johnny is inspired to establish the Vandals motorcycle club in 1960s Chicago. He assembles a motley crew, including Brucie, Benny, Cal and Zipco. Exuberant outsider Kathy falls under Bennys spell, and they marry, but when the groom is the victim of a violent assault, Johnny exacts revenge, while Kathy fights for her husbands tormented soul. Drama, starring Tom Hardy, Jodie Comer and Austin Butler

programme.title: Jaws
programme.desc: A New England seaside towns tourist season is turned into a nightmare by a giant killer shark. The local police chiefs efforts to protect the public are thwarted by the greedy mayor, forcing him to join forces with a grizzled fisherman and an enthusiastic marine biologist to hunt and kill the monster predator. Steven Spielbergs blockbusting thriller, starring Roy Scheider, Richard Dreyfuss and Robert Shaw, with an Oscar-winning score by John Williams. The film also won Academy Awards for Best Sound and Best Film Editing

programme.title: Jaws 2
programme.desc: The seaside resort of Amity is terrorised once again by a man-eating great white shark. While police chief Brody struggles to alert the townsfolk to the magnitude of the danger, a group of teenagers - including Brodys two sons - is adrift at sea in waters hunted by the shark. Director Jeannot Szwarcs thriller sequel, starring Roy Scheider, Lorraine Gary and Murray Hamilton, with John Williams once more providing the acclaimed score

programme.title: The Saint
programme.desc: International thief Simon Templar, a cunning master of disguise with a Swiss bank account almost full enough to retire on, accepts one last job - to steal a female scientists formula for cold fusion. However, he breaks his own golden rule by getting emotionally involved with the woman, leading to a deadly chase as the pair meet up in Russia and try to flee from the real bad guys. Action adventure, starring Val Kilmer, Elisabeth Shue and Henry Goodman

programme.title: Reindeer Games
programme.desc: Convict Rudy learns his cellmate has a girlfriend on the outside who he has only ever communicated with by letter. When the romantic inmate is killed in a riot and Rudy is paroled, he decides to track this woman down and assume the dead mans identity. However, his deception draws him into a casino robbery being orchestrated by her crazed brother. Thriller, starring Ben Affleck, Charlize Theron and Gary Sinise

programme.title: Split
programme.desc: After being abducted by a kidnapper with multiple personalities, three young women are soon engaged in a fight for survival. Meanwhile, an oblivious psychiatrist tries to ease her patients fractured mind as a 24th character with apparent superhuman abilities attempts to dominate his body. M Night Shyamalans thriller, starring James McAvoy, Anya Taylor-Joy and Betty Buckley

programme.title: Oceans Twelve
programme.desc: The crooks reunite when an old enemy catches up with them and demands they repay the money they stole from him three years previously. In response, the gang comes up with another larcenous plan - but reckons without the interventions of a fellow thief and a sultry Interpol agent. Crime caper sequel, starring George Clooney, Brad Pitt, Julia Roberts, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Matt Damon, Andy Garcia and Don Cheadle

programme.title: The Surfer
programme.desc: A father returns to Australia to buy his childhood home. To celebrate, he takes his teenage son to Luna Bay so they can surf together. However, he becomes locked in a battle of one-upmanship with local thugs. Thriller, starring Nicolas Cage and Julian McMahon

programme.title: Unhinged
programme.desc: Following a minor road-rage incident, single mother Rachel is terrorised by a seemingly mentally ill stranger. She finds herself and everyone she loves the target of a man who feels invisible and is looking to make one last mark upon the world by teaching her a series of deadly lessons. Psychological thriller, starring Russell Crowe and Caren Pistorius

programme.title: Three Days of the Condor
programme.desc: A bookish CIA researcher returns to his field office to find all his colleagues have been murdered in his absence. When he tries to uncover the truth, he also ends up targeted for assassination by his own agency, and is forced to go on the run to discover the reasons why. Sydney Pollacks thriller, starring Robert Redford, Faye Dunaway, Cliff Robertson and Max von Sydow

programme.title: The Last Stop In Yuma County
programme.desc: While stuck at a rural Arizona rest stop, a salesman is thrust into a hostage situation by the arrival of two ruthless bank robbers. Writer/director Francis Galluppis crime thriller, starring Jim Cummings, Faizon Love and Jocelin Donahue

programme.title: Layer Cake
programme.desc: A London cocaine dealer is all set to leave the criminal world behind and start a new life abroad. However, his plans are thwarted when he is asked to track down a gangsters drug-addicted daughter and locate a stolen shipment of Ecstasy. Crime thriller, starring Daniel Craig, Michael Gambon, Colm Meaney, Kenneth Cranham and Sienna Miller

programme.title: The Day of the Jackal
programme.desc: A group of conspirators contracts the Jackal, a professional hitman, to assassinate President Charles de Gaulle of France. The killer starts to put his painstaking plans into action, creating a new identity, establishing his alibi and commissioning a custom-made weapon, while out-foxing the French police at every turn. Fred Zinnemanns adaptation of Fredericks Forsyth thriller, with Edward Fox, Michael Lonsdale, Alan Badel, Tony Britton and Cyril Cusack

programme.title: Jaws 2
programme.desc: The seaside resort of Amity is terrorised once again by a man-eating great white shark. While police chief Brody struggles to alert the townsfolk to the magnitude of the danger, a group of teenagers - including Brodys two sons - is adrift at sea in waters hunted by the shark. Director Jeannot Szwarcs thriller sequel, starring Roy Scheider, Lorraine Gary and Murray Hamilton, with John Williams once more providing the acclaimed score

programme.title: Jaws 3
programme.desc: A shark is captured by divers and put on display in a Florida marine centre, where it ultimately dies. However, examination of the body reveals the seemingly fully-grown shark was actually a baby - and its enormous, ferocious mother soon comes looking for it. Thriller sequel, originally released in cinemas in 3D, starring Dennis Quaid, Simon MacCorkindale, Louis Gossett Jr and Bess Armstrong

programme.title: Reindeer Games
programme.desc: Convict Rudy learns his cellmate has a girlfriend on the outside who he has only ever communicated with by letter. When the romantic inmate is killed in a riot and Rudy is paroled, he decides to track this woman down and assume the dead mans identity. However, his deception draws him into a casino robbery being orchestrated by her crazed brother. Thriller, starring Ben Affleck, Charlize Theron and Gary Sinise

programme.title: Oceans Twelve

Crime caper sequel, starring George Clooney, Brad Pitt, Julia Roberts, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Matt Damon, Andy Garcia and Don Cheadle

programme.title: Oceans Thirteen
programme.desc: Danny Ocean rounds up his band of crooks for one last heist. Gang member Reuben has been left traumatised and in a coma after being double-crossed by crooked casino owner Willy Bank, and Danny decides that payback is in order. He plans a scheme that will leave Bank penniless, but needs the help of an old enemy. Comedy crime caper sequel, with George Clooney, Al Pacino, Brad Pitt, Matt Damon, Andy Garcia, Don Cheadle and Elliott Gould

programme.title: Sleepers
programme.desc: Four teenagers are sentenced to reform school after a prank results in the accidental death of an old man, and suffer sexual abuse at the hands of the guards. Years later, when the boys have grown up and begun to follow very different professions, a chance encounter with one of their abusers inspires them to plot revenge. Drama, starring Brad Pitt, Robert De Niro, Dustin Hoffman, Kevin Bacon, Jason Patric and Minnie Driver

programme.title: Escape from Alcatraz
programme.desc: A cunning convict with a history of making escape attempts is transferred to the notorious high-security island prison off the California coast, from which no one has ever broken out. Continually at odds with the brutal warden, he and three fellow prisoners hatch a plan to make it to freedom on an improvised raft. Thriller, based on a true story, starring Clint Eastwood, Patrick McGoohan, Roberts Blossom and Fred Ward

programme.title: Hannibal
programme.desc: Fugitive serial killer Dr Hannibal Lecter has gone into hiding as an academic in Italy, but a disfigured victim is determined to find him and inflict a gruesome revenge. FBI agent Clarice Starling is once again drawn into the doctors deadly orbit as she finds herself being used as bait for the avengers trap. Ridley Scotts thriller sequel, starring Anthony Hopkins, Julianne Moore, Gary Oldman and Ray Liotta

programme.sub-title: Queens for a Day - Part One

Meanwhile, Jack gives advice to Ro, who feels unable to tell her family and fiance she is gay. American sitcom, guest starring Jamie-Lynn DiScala (The Sopranos)

American comedy, starring Kristin Davis, Sarah Jessica Parker and Cynthia Nixon

programme.title: Sex and the City
programme.desc: Carries designer shoes go missing at a party, and Bradys chickenpox provides the perfect ice-breaker for Miranda after a dashing doctor moves into her building. Samantha is upset by the service in a restaurant, while Harrys constant post-wedding nudity troubles Charlotte. American comedy, starring Sarah Jessica Parker, Cynthia Nixon, Kim Cattrall and Kristin Davis

programme.desc: A TV appearance sees Spencer share airtime with a player he has an antagonistic history with, but it soon becomes a physical confrontation

programme.title: Ballers

programme.sub-title: One Car, Two Car, Red Car, Blue Car
programme.desc: Turtle goes to Ari for advice about his career path and E gets nervous about Charlies pilot after receiving some unsolicited feedback from his new girlfriend. Comedy drama, starring Kevin Connolly and Jerry Ferrara

programme.title: Entourage
programme.desc: Production on Vinces latest film is put back, leaving him at a loose end. Andrew claims he has ended his fling with a co-worker, but Ari tells Lloyd to keep an eye on him. Drama searches for actresses to play his new love interest, Jamie-Lynn and Turtle go shopping, and E thinks about the future

programme.title: The Office (US)
programme.desc: Michael prepares for his last-ever Dundie awards, and asks Deangelo to help him host the ceremony - but as the event gets under way, it becomes clear his replacement is not up to the job. Meanwhile, Pam and Jim discover Erin wants to break up with Gabe, and Dwight has trouble hiding his jealousy. Comedy, starring Steve Carell

programme.title: The Zen Diaries of Garry Shandling
programme.desc: Part one of two. An intimate portrait of the iconic American comedian, Garry Shandling, featuring interviews with many of his family, closest friends and admirers, including Jim Carrey, Sacha Baron Cohen, Bob Saget and Jerry Seinfeld. The documentary also features an array of candid home audio and video footage, and clips of over four decades worth of television appearances

programme.title: The Zen Diaries of Garry Shandling

An intimate portrait of the iconic American comedian, Garry Shandling, featuring interviews with many of his family, closest friends and admirers, including Jim Carrey, Sacha Baron Cohen, Bob Saget and Jerry Seinfeld. programme.desc: The engineer examines the stories of six battles that shaped British history, beginning with Scotlands battle against the English at Bannockburn. programme.title: Secrets of Great British Castles
programme.desc: Dan Jones heads to the south-east of England to explore the turbulent history of Dover Castle. He reveals that Henry II ordered its construction not only as a statement of royal power, but also out of guilt for the murder of Thomas Becket, the Archbishop of Canterbury, in 1170. Dan discovers how a vast network of tunnels was used to defend the castle, including underground barracks built during the Napoleonic Wars and a nuclear bunker created during the Cold War

programme.title: Life After People
programme.desc: From soaring skyscrapers such as One World Trade Center to impenetrable vaults like Fort Knox, humanitys strongest structures were engineered to defy disaster. However, in a world without people, even the mightiest would begin to crack and collapse in time. This episode monitors their likely decay and destruction

programme.title: Life After People
programme.desc: Experts discuss the dangers of water in a world without human beings, speculating on what would happen if rainwater submerged New Orleans and corrosion toppled Seattles Space Needle

programme.title: Kevin Costners The West
programme.desc: The Fetterman Fight, also known as the Fetterman Massacre. In 1866 Wyoming, a group of infantry, cavalry, and civilians under the command of Captain William Fetterman was wiped out by thousands of Native warriors of the Lakota Sioux, Northern Cheyenne, and Arapaho tribes. The site of the battle was Fort Phil Kearney, one of many forts along the Bozeman Trail, built to connect settlers to gold mines out West

programme.title: Kevin Costners The West
programme.desc: An epic journey through the birth of the American West. programme.title: Live Premier League
programme.desc: Leeds United v Chelsea (Kick-off 8.15pm). Coverage of the top-flight match at Elland Road. This was once one of the most fiercly-contested fixtures on the football calendar, especially in the 1960s when both clubs battled each other for honours, and culminated in the 1970 FA Cup final, which is regarded as one of the most physical matches in English football history and even went to a replay staged at Old Trafford, with Chelsea eventually lifting the trophy

She also talks to Dathaí de Paor about Lady Catherine Power of Curraghmore House, while MacDara Ó Conaola tells her about well-known sculptor Albert Power. programme.title: James Mays Big Trouble in Model Britain
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary following a year at British toymaker Hornby Hobbies as it teeters on the brink of collapse. Director Simon Kohler assesses the state of his beloved business after his four-year absence, while master modeller Jim is given the biggest build of his career

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A man fears for his life after being stopped by a cartel in Laredo, clubbers in Detroit are found with drugs disguised in liquid, and officers stop a shipment of frozen rats

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Border officers in Detroit apprehend a woman after finding a handgun and ammunition in her vehicle, and officers in Eagle Pass find $150,000-worth of methamphetamine

programme.title: Speed with Guy Martin
programme.desc: The motorbike racer takes part in four more speed-based challenges and gets his hands dirty in unique engineering projects to discover what makes things go fast. In the first programme, he finds out how far its possible to travel on a bicycle during 24 hours of non-stop pedalling. With the help of bike experts Miles Kingsbury and Mike Burrows he builds a tandem, and pairs up with his friend, endurance expert Jason Miles, to see how far they can push their bodies. In the build-up to the final record attempt at the historic Goodwood Motor Circuit, Guy also learns about the science of cooking for athletes with nutritionist Nigel Mitchell, who instructs him to lose five kilos and recommends a new diet regimen

programme.title: Speed with Guy Martin
programme.desc: The motorcycle racer heads to Colorado where he hopes to win one of Americas oldest races - the Pikes Peak International Hill Climb. In this annual contest, known as the Race to the Clouds, riders compete against the clock on a gruelling mountainside track that finishes more than 13,000ft above sea level. To learn the skills required in hill-climb events, Guy visits the birthplace of the sport - Shelsley Walsh in Worcestershire. Racing up the course in an F1-style car, he realises sheer horsepower and driving precision are vital, but he must also take a high-altitude fitness test in a hypoxic chamber to prepare for the challenge ahead

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Suspicions are raised when a routine x-ray reveals suspicious packages hidden inside the tyres of a pick-up truck. Officers also seize a large shipment of marijuana

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: People forced out of their homes in Honduras by the notorious MS-13 gang plead their case for asylum in America. Officers discover 3,000lb of marijuana hidden in a cargo truck

programme.title: Train Rescue Down Under
programme.desc: A maintenance team attempts to overhaul a finicky gearbox while another team must shunt an electric passenger train across multiple rail crossings during peak hour

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff, Chris Harris and Paddy McGuinness set out on an expedition across Iceland, with the help of some temperamental old British cars. Back in the UK, Freddie gets his hands on American sports car the Chevrolet Corvette

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Paddy McGuinness reviews the very rare, very expensive Aston Martin Victor, while Freddie Flintoff sets out to become a qualified racing driver. Chris Harris investigates the stranger-than-fiction story of the time-travelling DMC DeLorean

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers explore how Mediterranean cuisine and ingredients have influenced British culinary culture since it was first introduced by the Romans, and prepare their favourite recipes

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick visits Europes largest tea plantation, on the banks of the River Fal, bakes a simple yet sumptuous fruited tea loaf and travels to Penzance, where he enjoys an invigorating dip in the UKs largest outdoor seawater lido. He also finds out how Cornwall inspired Charles Dickens and how the county found its way into A Christmas Carol

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef glimpses life in Cornwall 2,000 years ago as he explores the atmospheric ruins of the ancient village of Carn Euny. Rick also cooks his favourite Sunday lunch, a hearty steak and kidney pudding, and goes for a bracing ride on a beautiful hand-built boat

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Satirist, presenter and producer Munya Chawawa, comedian Bob Mortimer, Professor Alice Roberts and radio presenter Snoochie Shy join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games
programme.desc: Former winners Maisie Adam, Ivo Graham, Dev Griffin and Zoe Lyons test their general knowledge skills on day three, while Richard Osman asks the questions

programme.title: Richard Osmans House of Games
programme.desc: Former winners Angela Barnes, Kemah Bob, Ade Edmondson and Beattie Edmondson test their general knowledge skills, while Richard Osman asks the questions

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: In an extended version of the quite interesting quiz, Sandi Toksvig puts the UK-US Special Relationship under the microscope. Kemah Bob, Alex Edelman, David Mitchell and series regular Alan Davies hope they dont fall foul of that klaxon

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Team captains Sean Lock and Jon Richardson are joined by Dragons Den panellist Kelly Hoppen, Olympic gymnast Louis Smith and comedians Henning Wehn and David ODoherty to discuss and dissect the events that set the British publics chins wagging over the past week. Jimmy Carr hosts the irreverent panel show

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Stephen Mangan hosts an extended episode of the current affairs quiz, with Ian Hislop and Paul Merton joined by Ed Davey MP and Rachel Parris

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Host Dara O Briain and regulars Hugh Dennis and Andy Parsons are joined by Rob Beckett, Gary Delaney, Sara Pascoe and Josh Widdicombe on the topical comedy quiz. The panellists give their take on the weeks major news stories and participate in a series of stand-up spots and improvised games. First shown in June 2014

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Snooker player Stephen Hendry, presenter Laura Whitmore and comedian-actors Chris McCausland and Maisie Adam join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the comedy panel show. As usual, the participants set out to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible fibs about themselves in a bid to secure a team victory, through rounds including Home Truths and Quick-fire Lies

programme.title: Survivor South Africa
programme.desc: The tension is building as the finale of this series of the hit format nears - in this edition, Katinka comes to Tom with a plan for Werner, but Tom then approaches Werner with a request...

programme.title: Survivor South Africa
programme.desc: The reality contest set in the Palawan province of the Philippines nears its end. Tom comes to accept the fact that he has to betray Werner in order to win with how the jury has come to be

programme.title: James Mays Big Trouble in Model Britain
programme.desc: Part two of two. Ken, head of audio development, is sent on a top-secret mission to capture the sound of a steam locomotive for its potential use in a new model, while marketing and development director Simon Kohler takes on two of his biggest rivals in a dramatic showdown. Plus, the company takes on its first female product designer in the shape of Caitlin Williams

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers find a manmade compartment within the trailer of a truck returning Stateside, and two Americans arouse suspicions with an unsafe lane change at the US-Canada border

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers at Eagle Pass intercept a driver smuggling narcotics over the border, and a group of passengers in Laredo refuse to admit to owning an air compressor full of rifles

programme.title: Speed with Guy Martin
programme.desc: The motorcycle racer leaves his comfort zone as he attempts to set a world speed record for a hovercraft. These machines are notoriously difficult to control, so to learn the basic skills needed hes put through his paces by Royal Marines in a military training operation. To achieve his goal, Guy will need to stay over 86mph for a kilometre, but at these speeds, because of the hovercrafts inherent instability, even the most experienced pilots can lose control - and the worsening weather makes things much more challenging

programme.title: Speed with Guy Martin
programme.desc: The motorbike fan takes on the challenge of building the worlds fastest soapbox racer in an attempt to set a new speed record using just the pull of gravity and a tarmac road. To get to grips with going blisteringly fast on a public road, Guy tries his hand at street luge with former global champion Helene Schmit, before joining his team of engineers to explore the science of rolling resistance and the importance of tyre pressure. Armed with what they believe to be the perfect formula, they produce a unique soapbox cart inspired by Mother Nature and, after training with the Team GB womens bobsled pair, confidence is high - but are disaster and mayhem just around the corner?

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: Officers put their lives on the line as they prepare to transfer two members of a cartel. In Laredo, a cop from Caracas, Venezuela, pleads his case for asylum in the United States

programme.title: Border Force: Americas Gatekeepers
programme.desc: A refugee from war-torn Venezuela tells officers how she paid human traffickers to smuggle her through Central America and to the Mexico-United States border. In Laredo, an American couple caught smuggling methamphetamine inside cans of vegetables crumble while being questioned and give officers information about a chain of so-called stash houses where drugs and illegal immigrants are being kept

programme.title: Train Rescue Down Under
programme.desc: A rusty 10-ton water tank gets cut off of a vintage engine in the Adelaide Hills, and Kuranda Scenic Railway carriages get spruced up by the Queensland Rail carpentry team

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff, Paddy McGuinness and Chris Harris set out to find interesting old cars for new drivers, then put them to the test on a road trip through Devon and Cornwall. Chris also drives the original supercar, Lamborghinis legendary Miura

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Freddie Flintoff, Chris Harris and Paddy McGuinness saddle up the team bus for an RV road trip across Floridas swampy Everglades to hunt down some weird and wonderful local motorsports

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers prepare dishes from their favourite cookery books, explaining their value as social documents that reveal a great deal about people and what they ate. The duo meet Ivan Day, who has one of the most extensive collections of recipe books in the UK, and share stories of renowned food writers such as Elizabeth David and Isabella Beeton

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef witnesses a fishing method frozen in time, where the use of engines and winches is banned, and goes fishing under sail for what he considers to be the best oysters in the world. Back on dry land, Rick cooks a warming fish soup called Cullen Skink, and discovers the all-but-forgotten story of Cornwalls ancient capital, Lostwithiel

programme.title: Rick Steins Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick visits a deer farm near Bodmin Moor run by Pip and Matt Smith, before returning to the kitchen in Padstow to make a simple venison Wellington. Later, he spends an afternoon on Porthgwarra beach with the artist Hannah Woodman, whose work is inspired by the sea-worn landscape of west Cornwall, before defining the Cornish sense of humour over a pint with comedian Jonny Cowling

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Comedians Lucy Beaumont and Desiree Burch, Strictly judge Anton Du Beke and actor Ralf Little join host Rob Brydon and regular captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack on the offbeat panel show. programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo, Clegg and Foggy decide to invite long-lost school friends from the town for a drink at the pub on Christmas Eve. Festive instalment of the long-running comedy from 1981, starring Peter Sallis, Brian Wilde and Bill Owen

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo, Clegg and Foggy head for the seaside to spend Christmas in a caravan, leaving Sid and Wally behind. Festive instalment of the long-running rural comedy from 1982, starring Peter Sallis, Bill Owen and Brian Wilde

programme.title: Only Fools and Horses
programme.desc: Rodney dates an artist who turns out to be the daughter of the Duke of Maylebury. Del sees the chance for the Trotter family to marry into the aristocracy, and disastrously gatecrashes a party at the Dukes country estate. Christmas special from 1986, starring David Jason and Nicholas Lyndhurst

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo, Clegg and Foggy try to grant Sam his final wish and sneak him out of his sick-bed for a secret rendezvous - but when he drops dead, things begin to get out of hand. Feature-length Christmas special from 1983, starring Peter Sallis, Bill Owen and Brian Wilde

programme.title: Keeping Up Appearances
programme.desc: Hyacinth decides to build a dream kitchen in time for Christmas - but a series of unforeseen setbacks, culminating in Richard contracting an embarrassing fungal infection, reduces her plans to a farce. Meanwhile, Rose and Daisy make an alarming discovery in their fathers room. Festive special from 1994, starring Patricia Routledge and Clive Swift

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: David Jason stars in this follow-up to Roy Clarkes popular comedy Open All Hours. Once the dogsbody, Granville has inherited the business from his miserly uncle Albert Arkwright, but he is not alone in running the shop - he now has his own assistant in the shape of his son Leroy, who proves more popular with the ladies than his dad ever did. Its a typical day at the grocers as Granville tries to get a date with old flame Mavis without her terrifying sister Madge finding out, while Leroy shuns the old delivery bike in favour of an altogether more attractive way to take out the orders. James Baxter and Lynda Baron co-star, with appearances by Johnny Vegas, Mark Williams, Brigit Forsyth, Nina Wadia and Sally Lindsay

programme.title: Blackadder
programme.desc: It is Christmas Eve 1850, and the kindly Ebenezer Blackadder spends the festive season being taken advantage of by his relatives, his neighbours and even Queen Victoria. When he is visited by the Spirit of Christmas, he gains an insight into the dastardly deeds of his ancestors, and starts to wonder if he would be better off following in their footsteps. Comic reversal of the classic Dickens tale, starring Rowan Atkinson, Tony Robinson, Stephen Fry, Hugh Laurie, Robbie Coltrane and Miranda Richardson

programme.desc: It is Christmas Eve 1850, and the kindly Ebenezer Blackadder spends the festive season being taken advantage of by his relatives, his neighbours and even Queen Victoria. When he is visited by the Spirit of Christmas, he gains an insight into the dastardly deeds of his ancestors, and starts to wonder if he would be better off following in their footsteps. Comic reversal of the classic Dickens tale, starring Rowan Atkinson, Tony Robinson, Stephen Fry, Hugh Laurie, Robbie Coltrane and Miranda Richardson

programme.title: The Vicar of Dibley
programme.desc: Part one of two. Geraldines head is turned by a particularly charming newcomer to the village - played by Robin Hood star Richard Armitage - and it soon becomes clear he feels the same. Keeley Hawes guest stars, with Dawn French, Emma Chambers, Roger Lloyd Pack, James Fleet, Gary Waldhorn, Trevor Peacock and John Bluthal

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: The pals look forward to celebrating Christmas, but an unexpected guest disrupts their plans as Richie suffers delusions of grandeur and the whole spirit of the festive season is jeopardised. Anarchic comedy, starring Adrian Edmondson and Rik Mayall

programme.title: The Royle Family
programme.desc: The family members finish their big Christmas Day dinner and Barbara senses that her turkey wasnt up to scratch. Soon after Antony leaves for girlfriend Emmas house and Dave departs to take Nana home, Denise goes into labour upstairs in the bathroom and Jim tries to comfort her. Festive episode of the comedy from 1999

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to Dartford to meet Scott and Jenny, whose third son Charlie was born with cerebral palsy and developmental delay. The boy needs round-the-clock care, which his mother gave up work to provide, but now he is 13, the family are struggling to cope in their small home. Having heard of their plight, the DIY SOS team turns up to transform their end terrace, backed up by an army of local tradespeople, with designer Naomi Cleaver on hand to ensure they dont stray too far from her vision

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles and his crack team of builders, plasterers and electricians come to the aid of Frank and Christine Burrows in Wigan, Greater Manchester. In 2012, the Burrows 35-year-old son Mark retrained as a scaffolder to follow in his fathers footsteps, but was paralysed as the result of an unprovoked attack that left him with severe brain damage. Mark now needs constant care, but the Burrows family home is not yet fit for purpose, so Frank and Christine have been forced to take their son to a care home 15 miles away. With the help of flamboyant designer Laurence Llewelyn Bowen, Nicks experts set about constructing a self-contained apartment alongside the Burrows two-bedroom bungalow, which will provide Mark with the space, independence and security he will need to return home for good after spending two years away

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to Swansea to meet 15-year-old Jack, who suffers from a rare form of muscular dystrophy that has led to a lifetime of painful operations. His mother Helen and older brother Daniel do all they can to help but as he grows it has become impossible to get him upstairs and now he has to sleep in the living room, leaving the rest of the family with nowhere to socialise. Having heard of their plight, the DIY SOS team turns up to transform their three-bedroom semi, backed up by an army of local tradespeople, with designer Gabrielle Blackman on hand to ensure they dont stray too far from her vision

programme.title: MasterChef USA
programme.desc: Across a three-course menu, the finalists must ensure every plate is up to Michelin star standards for them to take home the title of Americas MasterChef

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A case becomes personal for Pride when a murder victim is identified as Petty Officer Calvin Parks, who the agent used to mentor when the young man was in a gang. LaSalle question members of two rival gangs, but a drive-by shooting linked to the killing leads to an accusation from a mayoral candidate that the NCIS team has stirred up violence, and the investigators begin to question whether the death has a political connection. Crime drama, starring Scott Bakula and Lucas Black

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A Navy lieutenant on shore leave stumbles from a busy bar and runs headlong into the path of an oncoming taxi, sustaining fatal injuries. Dr Loretta Wade quickly concludes that there is more to the case than meets the eye and eventually identifies the cause of death as bubonic plague, which brings Tony DiNozzo to town, having had a brush with the disease himself. He and Pride go aboard the dead mans ship to try to pinpoint the source of the disease and halt its spread. Crime drama, starring Scott Bakula

programme.title: Elementary
programme.desc: Holmes is conducting research in a hospital morgue when he stumbles upon a string of murders, crimes that went undetected by the staff as the victims were all weak or terminally ill. Tapping into his own vast knowledge of pathology, as well as Watsons medical knowledge, the sleuth deduces the people were killed by one of the medical staff - a so-called angel of mercy. Now all he has to do is find the culprit before more lives are claimed. Jonny Lee Miller and Lucy Liu star

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Jo and Ash deal with a patient whose chronic cough leaves him struggling to breathe, while Joel and Nic treat a man whos fallen from a ladder while wielding a hedge trimmer

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Liverpool Womens Hospital opens its doors to 16-year-old Heidi, who is accompanied by her own mum Jo, and Adele, the mother of the babys father, who has decided to take her sons place in the delivery room. Dad-to-be Gavin hopes poetry will help his jittery wife Michelle get through giving birth to their second child, and 46-year-old Jane finds herself laughing through her daughter Louises contractions as a means of coping with the stress of being a birthing partner

programme.title: Tom Daley: Illegal to Be Me
programme.desc: The Olympic diving champion investigates homophobic behaviour around the Commonwealth, travelling to some of the countries where homosexuality is a crime and even punishable by death. Daley talks to sportspeople facing persecution and advocates fighting for change, including Michael Gunning of Jamaica, Indias Dutee Chand and swimmers Theresa Goh (of Singapore) and Amini Fonua (of Tonga)

programme.desc: The cooks level up the basic meal deal and create a menu entirely out of leftovers. But one cooks journey in the contest comes to a premature end

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: Matthew and Jericka bought his grandparents house, but while its big enough to grow into, the design is outdated. Jonathan and Drew rework the main living areas

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles is in Loughborough to meet a family of five, whose identical twin babies have been diagnosed as having a form of dwarfism, while at the age of 41, dad Mark is recovering from aggressive bowel and liver cancer. Now they are struggling for space. Having heard of their plight, the DIY SOS team turns up to transform their home, backed up by an army of local tradespeople, with designer Gabrielle Blackman on hand to ensure they dont stray too far from her vision

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to Epsom to meet paramedics Sam and Ben Laws, who have two children, one with special needs. The couple already find it hard, working opposite shifts which mean they often dont see each other for days on end - and to make matters worse, they have found their house to be inadequate for their requirements. After a close friend nominates them for the DIY SOS treatment, Nick and the team - bolstered by an army of local tradespeople - turn up to transform it into a home they can enjoy as a family, now and in the future

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles comes to the aid of Liz and Jason Liversidge, a Hull couple in desperate need of help in future-proofing their family home. Not long after getting married and starting a family, Jason was diagnosed with both Fabrys disease, which causes a build-up of poisonous toxins in the body, and Motor Neurone Disease, which drastically reduced his life expectancy. The pair also discovered that Jason would have passed Fabrys disease on to his two daughters, which means that once her husband is gone, Liz will need all the help she can get in managing her childrens condition. Nick joins forces with designer Oliver Heath and an army of volunteers to put together a home in which Jason can build meaningful memories with his girls, but one which also gives Liz the best chance of providing for their future needs

programme.title: DIY SOS

programme.title: MasterChef Junior USA Specials 2023
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay welcomes nine young culinary contestants to cook up seasonal delights. The chefs prepare a dish celebrating holiday traditions, using ingredients hidden in snowmen

programme.title: Pete Wicks: For Dogs Sake
programme.desc: Pete meets Flower, the first dog ever to take a dislike to him . He also helps Heidi and Marvin, both facing serious medical challenges

programme.title: Louis Theroux - A Place for Paedophiles
programme.desc: The broadcaster reports from Coalinga State Hospital in California, home to more than 500 sex offenders, many of whom have already served lengthy prison sentences and are deemed unsafe for release. During his visit, Louis finds out about a therapy programme run by psychologists who hope to rehabilitate willing participants - but many inmates refuse to take part, with only 13 having completed the course since it began

programme.title: Louis Therouxs Altered States
programme.desc: The documentary-maker explores the changing face of US culture, beginning with a look at a movement in Portland, Oregon, that seeks to broaden how the world views marriage in a time of rising divorce rates, suggesting that monogamy is not essential and that polyamorous or open relationships can be equally fulfilling. However, while Louis meets many who have found happiness with multiple partners, he also discovers tales of heartbreak and jealousy

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The midwives of Liverpool Womens Hospital invite viewers into the delivery suites one last time, introducing 27-year-old Gina and her partner James. The pair met at university, while Gina was on an exchange programme from Shanghai, and made their long-distance relationship work by chatting through cuddly toys via the internet. However, they must now demonstrate their maturity and become parents. Meanwhile, self-confessed baby machine Margy arrives expecting her fifth child, and childhood sweethearts Craig and Sarah, who faced parenthood at an early age, look forward to taking their next baby back to their own home rather than to their parents

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The documentary returns to capture life in the maternity unit at Liverpool Womens Hospital. Students Brooke and Tim, both aged 23, who became inseparable when they met in their first term at university, become parents for the first time and have difficulty deciding on a name for their baby, while things dont go according to plan in theatre for 40-year-old Hayley. She is afraid of being separated from her 23-year-old partner Nick, after he became critically ill during the pregnancy as a result of contracting pneumonia and septicaemia. Meanwhile, Tara, aged 36, has chosen her 16-year-old daughter Courtney as her birthing partner

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Today in Stoke, paramedics Mick and Rachel help a young man who has hurt his back. In Dudley, paramedics help a 74-year-old who had a shock from his internal defibrillator

programme.title: Hungry for It
programme.desc: The cooks level up vegetarian junk food and create a menu of meat alternatives for a packed-out hub, including Team GB medal-winners Kai Whyte and Charlotte Henshaw. In a tense Knives Out, the bottom two cooks must cook a frying pan pizza from scratch in just 15 minutes. At the end of the day, one more cook is sent packing, and just six cooks remain

programme.title: Joanna Lumleys Trans-Siberian Adventure
programme.desc: The actress embarks on her third travelogue, having previously traced the Nile from its source and sampled the varied rural, historical and urban cultures of Greece. This time, she sets out to travel 6,400 miles making use of the Trans-Siberian Railway, which is considered the longest railway line in the world. Joannas journey begins in Hong Kong, where she spent some of her childhood. She takes a bullet train to Beijing, where she meets a woman who claims to have known the last Chinese emperors favourite concubine, and officially joins the Trans-Siberian track. From there, she travels to the Great Wall, and takes an overnight train into Mongolia via the Gobi desert

programme.title: Joanna Lumleys Trans-Siberian Adventure
programme.desc: The actress reaches the midway point of her 6,000-mile journey from Hong Kong to Moscow via the Trans-Siberian Railway, taking in the varied sights of Mongolia. She spends time with native nomads, and visits a giant statue of Genghis Khan, as well as a gold mine. She also heads to the nations capital, Ulan Bator, where she tracks down the famous Mongolian throat-singers, before catching a train bound for Russia. However, making a start on the Siberian leg of her trek proves more difficult than Joanna expects when she experiences a spot of bother at the border

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Paul heads to County Durham to pick up a 1936 Singer Le Mans sports car and a pristine 1957, one-owner Lambretta LD 150, while Derek gets his hands on a 1962 MGA MK2 Coupe

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek is reunited with the vehicle he took his driving test in - a 1957 Ford 100E Estate. Dave is also on the trail for an Escort, this time a 1970s Mk1 twin cam

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: Focusing on the mass production of ammunition brought on by Samuel Colt, and the inadequacy of Soviet factory production which made the AK47 so effective

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Allied offensive in the Pacific, where Americas two-pronged attack led to heavy casualties on both sides, as the Japanese mounted a ferocious defence. Narrated by Laurence Olivier

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents more valuations at Hever Castle in Kent, where items brought along by the public include a medal given to a man who helped rescue survivors from the Titanic, pieces from the collection of ballerina Anna Pavlova and a pair of rare oriental plaques

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow

programme.title: Bangers and Cash

programme.desc: Exploring a serene institution in Wisconsin seized out of righteous anger, a Spanish settlement stained in innocent blood, and a subterranean lair in France with a disturbing objective

programme.title: David Jasons Great British Inventions

programme.desc: Sam Thompson, Joel Dommett and Kemi Rodgers host the companion show, featuring behind-the-scenes gossip, unseen clips, interviews and an insider guide to the trials

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Sleepy Goodmans Land, known as the greenest village in Midsomer, is bought by a Texas oilman. However, following the sale, a string of grisly murders ensues. Detective drama, starring Neil Dudgeon and Nick Hendrix

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Steve is forced to cover for Phil when the father-to-be discovers Gina has gone into labour two months early and rushes to the hospital to help with the nerve-racking delivery. Meanwhile, Merton is excited when it appears a drug dealer could soon be brought to justice. Drama, starring Mark Jordon, Tricia Penrose and Duncan Bell

programme.title: Good Witch
programme.sub-title: Not Getting Married Today - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Cassie discovers a 10-year-old girl - Pavla - playing in the bushes at Grey House. She is hiding from her adoptive parents, Eddie and Marla, who could use a little help from Cassie and Abigail as they forge their new family. Meanwhile, Martha announces that her son Michael is getting married. He and his fiancee Vanessa want a simple wedding, and Martha needs some gentle reminders from Cassie to not go overboard

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Hathaway and Lewis struggle to determine whether a death during a college-based clinical trial for a new antidepressant was murder or suicide, and receive little assistance from the institutions evasive psychiatric professor. A second students demise then leads to the revelation that the trials participants are all operating under the influence of a mind-altering drug, and that the lines between love, obsession and madness have become dangerously blurred. Guest starring Douglas Henshall (Primeval), Lucy Liemann (Rev) and Thomas Brodie Sangster (Love Actually)

programme.title: Zoo Days
programme.desc: The endangered red pandas have two cubs, which receive their first medical check-ups

programme.title: The Restaurant
programme.desc: Olympic Silver Medallist and World Champion rower Gary ODonovan acts as head chef. Growing up by the sea and spending much of his life on water there is a fishy theme flowing through his menu - but will it create a strong enough swell of positive reaction to deliver another top award - a 5-star rating?

programme.title: Worlds Greatest Hotels
programme.desc: A peek behind the scenes at the planets most iconic establishments

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The Aidensfield policemen are called to subdue anti-war protestors at a disused airfield, but the event has serious repercussions for Walker after he accidentally hits one of the mob with his truncheon. Younger is gutted to discover Rosie has feelings for new vet Fergus, who is the indirect cause of chaos when a cobra escapes from his car at the garage. Irritated that nobodys taking her snake-catching suggestions seriously, Peggy refuses to help with the hunt and drives off with David - straight into the arms of danger. With Jonathan Kerrigan, Gwen Taylor, Vanessa Hehir and Andrew Langtree

programme.title: The Darling Buds of May
programme.sub-title: The Happiest Days of Your Life - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Primrose falls for a roofing contractor, while the twins prove too much of a handful for their school, prompting a trip to view the facilities on offer at Brockhurst College. Nostalgic comedy drama, starring David Jason and Pam Ferris

programme.title: The Mayfair Hotel Megabuild
programme.desc: Just over halfway through the seven-year renovation project the team adopts unusual measures to make way for the next stage of the audacious build - a four-storey roof extension. Meanwhile, after the challenges of groundwater and an underground river have been overcome, the digging out of the basement reaches its fifth and deepest level

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Ray and Celia discuss their plans, Dylan is horrified and Paddy admits how much he misses his dad

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Dr Goodwin returns from Africa with Biafran orphan Nkeshi, and shocks his colleagues when they realise he has smuggled the child into the country illegally. The presence of an unhappy celebrity causes a paparazzi furore, and nearly costs Frankie his job. Dr Weatherill deals with an uncooperative alcoholic on her first day back at work. Medical drama, starring Paul Fox

programme.title: Agatha Christies Poirot
programme.desc: Former nanny Lavinia Seagram is found soaked in blood and it is believed she had turned to drink and drugs to commit suicide. However, Poirot is soon on the scent of troubled heiress Norma Restarick, who had problems of her own - not least confessing to the possibility she has killed someone herself. Guest starring Jemima Rooper, Zoe Wanamaker and Peter Bowles, with David Suchet as the Belgian sleuth

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Paul Nicholas guest stars as a Swedish sailor who waits for his ship home in Bernies funeral parlour - but may not be telling the truth about the contents of the coffin hes escorting. A trio of young joyriders steal Carols car while she is attending to a patient and decide to experiment with the drugs they find in her medical bag as well as selling them on to interested parties. Rosie and Fergus struggle to get their fledgling relationship off the ground as a series of interruptions plague their dates, while Bellamy starts to wonder whether trying again with Gina is really such a good idea. With Lisa Kay, Vanessa Hehir, Mark Jordon and Tricia Penrose

programme.title: Murder in the Pacific
programme.desc: The bomber reveals how he came to plant the explosives on the Greenpeace ship Rainbow Warrior, and the measures he took to escape New Zealand after the attack. He and another suspect reveal the origins of the mission - the French government convincing them that the KGB had infiltrated Greenpeace

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Becky hastens to Costellos bedside to cover her tracks, Will overhears Daniel asking Megan on a date, Theo sends Todd out for a run, and Dee-Dee refuses to commit to spending Christmas with Ollie

When the body of a local man is found at the foot of Carn Mohr Mountain and an isolated human heart on the loch shore, the towns normality is shattered and the nightmare begins. Thriller, starring Laura Fraser and Siobhan Finneran

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: Hathaway and Lewis investigate the murder of a businesswoman connected with an organisation that supports gifted children, who had apparently been blackmailing the father of one particularly promising youngster. Further deaths follow, and as the body count rises, they realise there is a decades-old secret at the heart of the case. Matters are complicated still further by the presence in Oxford of former MI5 spymaster Grace Orde, who is visiting to sign copies of her tell-all memoir - which provides a vital clue to the killers identity. Detective drama, guest starring Anna Chancellor and Cherie Lunghi, with Kevin Whately and Laurence Fox

programme.title: Zoo Days
programme.desc: Mick Jones, the head keeper of Chester Zoos Asian elephants, is given the dangerous task of introducing a female elephant named Birma to Upali, a resident bull elephant, in order to encourage a breeding programme

programme.title: The Loch
programme.desc: A human heart is discovered on the shores of the Loch, and forensic psychologist Blake Albrighton is brought in to join the investigating team. He quickly forms a disturbing theory about the motive behind the seemingly inexplicable murders, but Chief Inspector Frank Smilie is quick to dismiss his ideas. However, if the new arrival is correct, the once peaceful Highland community could be set to endure far more deaths, as a serial killer prowls the area. Crime drama, starring Laura Fraser, John Sessions and Don Gilet
